info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:59PM EDT until July 03 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NASH...NORTH CENTRAL EDGECOMBE AND HALIFAX COUNTIES... At 158 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles north of Dortches, or 14 miles north of Nashville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Scotland Neck, Enfield, Weldon, Whitakers, Glenview, Medoc Mountain State Park, Aventon and Tillery. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
